sentences.sContent: There is every prospect (= a strong possibility ) of the weather remaining dry this week.
sentences.sCn: 本周天气很有可能持续干燥。

sentences.sContent: ...They practically beg a user to ignore the long-suffering professor struggling to pass on accumulated wisdom from the front of the room - a prospect that teachers find most irritating and students view as...
...They say that they are drawn to the prospect of learning applications outside the classroom...

phrases.pCn: 光明的前景，辉煌的前程
展望；在期望中；可以预料到
期待，有希望；可以预料到

remMethod.val: pro(向前) ＋ spect(看) → 向前看 → 前景

trans.tranCn: 前景， 前途， 可能性； 景象， 景色； 可能成为主顾的人， 有希望的候选人
trans.tranOther: the possibility that something will happen
